ru.mobicomk.mfradio.util
Class Dloader

java.lang.Object
  ru.mobicomk.mfradio.util.Dloader
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class Dloader
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

Socket-based downloader class. Used for access to audio stream data through socket connection.

For connection information (site name, port number, etc.) this class uses URL of a resource. After establish connection (connect(java.lang.String)) class uses HTTP 1.1 protocol commands.

Example of use: 

 // ...
 // create new instance 
 Dloader dloader = new Dloader(controller); 
     // controller is an application controller object.
 
 // connect
 if (!dloader.connect(url)) {
     throw new IOException("Can't connect!");
 }

 // read responce code
 String[] resp = dloader.readResponceCode();
 if (!"200".equals(resp[1])) {
    throw new IOException("HTTP response code " + resp[1] + " " + resp[2]);
 }
 
 // read headers for streamType
 String streamType;
 Hashtable headers = dloader.readHeaders();
 if (headers.containsKey("content-type")) { 
     streamType = (String) headers.get("content-type");
 } else {
     streamType = "unknown";
 }
 
 // read data
 byte[] buffer = new byte[BUFFER_SIZE];
 int startOffset = 0;
 int bytesReaded = dloader.read(buffer, startOffset);
 dloader.disconnect();
 dloader = null;

 if (bytesReaded > 0) {
     // ...use data from buffer...
 }
 // ...

Author:
Roman Bondarenko

Method Detail

isConnected

public boolean isConnected()
Get downloader connection state.

Returns:
true if the downloader currenly connected to resource, false otherwise.

reconnect

public boolean reconnect()
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                         AppException
Re-connect to current resource.

Returns:
true if connected, false otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if user breaks download operation.
AppException - if site name or file name not specified or is empty.

connect

public boolean connect(java.lang.String url)
                throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                       AppException,
                       UrlFormatException
Connect to a given resource.

Parameters:
url - URL of a resource to connection.
Returns:
true if connected, false otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if user breaks download operation.
AppException - if site name or file name not specified or is empty.
UrlFormatException - if error during URL parsing.

disconnect

public void disconnect()
Thread-safe breaking of the current connection.

read

public int read(byte[] buffer,
                int startOffset)
         throws java.io.IOException,
                java.lang.InterruptedException
Read resource data to the buffer.

NOTE: buffer.length must be divisible by chunkSize.

Parameters:
buffer - buffer into which the data is read.
startOffset - The start offset of the data.
Returns:
Readed bytes count, or -1 if there is no more data because the end of the stream has been reached.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if I/O error occurs.
java.lang.InterruptedException - if user breaks download process.
See Also:
DataInputStream, DataInputStream.read(byte[])

readResponseCode

public java.lang.String[] readResponseCode()
                                    throws java.io.IOException
Get HTTP-response code for previous HTTP-request.

Using: 

 // ...
 // read responce code
 String[] resp = dloader.readResponceCode();
 if (!"200".equals(resp[1])) {
    throw new IOException("HTTP response code " + resp[1] + " " + resp[2]);
 }

Returns:
String array with response code and text representation of the response.

Structure of the result (example is "HTTP/1.0 200 OK") :

IndexDescriptionExample
0 Protocol HTTP/1.1
1 Response code 200
2 Text description of the response OK

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if I/O error occurs.

readHeaders

public java.util.Hashtable readHeaders()
                                throws java.io.IOException
Get all HTTP-response headers.

Using: 

 // ...
 // read headers for streamType
 String streamType;
 Hashtable headers = dloader.readHeaders();
 if (headers.containsKey("content-type")) {
     streamType = (String) headers.get("content-type");
 } else {
     streamType = "unknown";
 }
 // ...

Returns:
Hashtable with all headers: keys is a header names, values is a headers values.

Structure of the result :

KeyValue
content-type audio/mpeg
icy-name Sample station
icy-genre all
... ...

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if I/O error occurs.
See Also:
Hashtable

public void run()
Runnable interface implementation. Entry point of the dowloader thread.

run in interface java.lang.Runnable

Runnable, Runnable.run()
